text:
Welcome to our guessing game!

Before you begin your task, you'll complete a brief guided tutorial (~ 2 minutes) to understand the game.

Press Next to continue.

You're watching someone play the treasure game shown to the left.

The player controls a character assets/icon/human.png, and their goal is collect one of the four gems (triangle assets/icon/gem_triangle.png, square assets/icon/gem_square.png, hexagon assets/icon/gem_hexagon.png, or circle assets/icon/gem_circle.png).

The rules of the game are as follows:
  • The player can move on the white squares.
  • The player has a full view of the map at all time.
  • The player's goal is to collect exactly one target gem.
  • Keys unlock doors of the same color (e.g. red keys assets/icon/key_red.png unlock red doors assets/icon/door_red.png).
  • Each key can only be used once. Keys disappear after use.
  • Each box assets/icons/box.png may be empty assets/icons/box_empty.png or contain exactly one key assets/icon/box_with_key.png.
  • The player may or may not know what's in each box.
  • Neither you nor the player can see what's hidden in each box. But both of you can see all other objects in the scene.
  • There are at most two keys hidden among the boxes.
  • The player knows that the puzzle is solvable, which means there are just enough keys to reach any of the target gems.
Your task is to figure out what the player's goal is, and also what the player believes about the contents of the boxes.

Press the Next button to continue.

At each step in this game, you will watch the player take several actions.

We will then ask you one question about the player's goal, and another set of questions about what the player initially believed at the start of the game.

commentary:
The player picked up a red key. Which gem do you think they're trying to reach?

If more than one gem seems likely, you can select all likely gems. Remember that some keys might be hidden among the boxes.

queries.prompt: Which gem(s) are most likely to be the player's goal?

commentary:
Please read each of the following statements about what the player initially believed, and rate them on a scale from 1 to 7.

  • Rate 7 if you're certain the statement correctly describes the player's initial beliefs.
  • Rate 1 if you're certain the statement does not describe the player's initial beliefs.
  • Rate 4 if you think there's an even, 50-50 chance whether the statement is a true or false description of what the player initially believed.


Remember that the player just picked up a red key.

options: The player initially believed that a blue key was more likely to be in box 1 than box 2.
The player initially thought that there must be a blue key in box 3.

commentary: What about now? Do these actions make any goal more likely than the others? And do they indicate what the player initially believed was inside the boxes?

The player initially knew there was a red key in box 1.
The player initially thought there was a red key in box 1.

option: Guess one of the two likely gems, and hope for the best.

Guess all of the gems, because who knows?
